creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: woman riding on a billowing cloud, facing forward, resting PR hand on open book of music; horse behind her; peacock at LRC; woman is holding a large instrument in PL hand
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription, Label

-- inscribed in plate at top: [SANGVINEVS]
-- numbered in plate at upper right: 1
-- in graphite on mount: 121757.4
-- on verso: 178

label on back of mat: Kennedy Galleries, Inc. 40 W. 57th St., 5th Floor, N.Y. 10019 / 212-541-9600 / Solis Virgil / The Four Humours Set of 4 / Year 0000 / Engraving / 191114 / Number 19494 / Stock Number 121757.004
provenance: [Kennedy Galleries, New York, no. 19494; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Sanguine Temperament, From the Four Temperaments, Plate 1
